Ad Text:
AI Implementation Specialist

Full-time | 6-month contract (with potential 12-month extension)
Location: Canberra, ACT

Are you passionate about driving responsible and innovative AI adoption across an enterprise? We're seeking an experienced AI Implementation Specialist to lead a transformative initiative that will shape the future of AI capability within a major Australian institution.

About the Role

This is a pivotal opportunity to contribute to a high-impact AI Implementation Accelerator program. You'll work closely with internal stakeholders and a specialised AI consultancy to deliver strategic outcomes aligned with a broader digital transformation agenda.

Key Responsibilities
Lead and coordinate activities outlined in the AI Implementation roadmap.
Collaborate with external consultants to implement enterprise AI strategy, governance frameworks, and capability models.
Develop policies and guidelines for ethical and compliant AI use.
Design and deliver AI literacy programs for staff and students.
Identify and prioritise AI use cases across the organisation.
Support pilot programs for AI initiatives and define success metrics.
Establish and manage an executive-level AI and Data governance body.
Prepare business cases to secure funding for future AI phases.
Engage stakeholders across faculties and business units to ensure alignment.
Monitor and report on progress, risks, and benefits of AI initiatives.
Promote a culture of innovation and responsible AI adoption.
Skills & Experience
Proven expertise in enterprise AI strategy, governance, and implementation.
Experience designing and facilitating workshops and AI literacy training.
Strong stakeholder engagement and change management capabilities.
Demonstrated success in delivering innovative AI solutions and pilots.
Deep understanding of AI technologies, data governance, and compliance.
Experience developing policies for emerging technologies.
Excellent communication and influencing skills, especially with executive stakeholders.
Strong project management skills in dynamic environments.
Working Arrangements
Full-time position based in Canberra.
No security clearance required; AFP check mandatory.
Applicants must be Australian citizens or permanent residents.

Linda Jona
Consultant

Let's connect

ManpowerGroup is committed to being a Diversity Confident Recruiter and encourages applications from people from a diverse range of backgrounds, including people with a disability. Please indicate your preferred method of communication in your resume and please let us know if you require any reasonable adjustments should you be contacted for an interview.

Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply.

By submitting your resume and other personal information with this application you are consenting to this information being collected in line with our privacy policy. Follow the link to learn more - www.manpowergroup.com.au/privacy-policy

Job Title: Head of Data Governance, Privacy and Regulatory Analytics
Ad Text:
Unique, highly visible role, working with a well-regarded executive leadership team.
Excellent work life balance and a real opportunity to have immediate impact
Sydney Based. Up to $250k base + super + Benefits
About the Role:

We are seeking a Head of Data Governance, Privacy, and Regulatory Analytics to lead and shape the organisation’s approach to regulatory data strategy, privacy frameworks, and governance. This is a pivotal leadership role in a highly data-driven environment, working closely with regulators and senior stakeholders to ensure compliance while driving innovation and efficiency.

Key Responsibilities:

Regulatory Data Strategy: Develop and implement strategies to meet regulatory requirements, including Economic and Financial Statistics (EFS) reporting and Open Banking compliance.
Regulator Engagement: Build and maintain strong relationships with regulatory bodies such as APRA, ASIC ACCC and OAIC, ensuring accurate and transparent communication.
Data Governance Leadership: Establish and maintain frameworks for data ownership, lineage, and retention, ensuring the integrity and quality of critical data elements (CDEs).
Privacy Oversight: Manage first-line privacy responsibilities, including Privacy Impact Assessments and embedding privacy by design into business processes.
Cross-Team Collaboration: Partner with risk, compliance, and technology teams to deliver integrated data solutions aligned with regulatory and business objectives.
Continuous Improvement: Stay ahead of evolving regulatory requirements, driving innovation and efficiency in data systems and reporting processes.
What We’re Looking For:

We’re seeking a dynamic leader with a strong regulatory focus, technical expertise, and the ability to bridge the gap between data systems and compliance.

Proven leadership in data governance within financial services, including managing CDEs, data lineage, and retention.
Extensive experience in regulatory reporting, particularly EFS and Open Banking standards.
Strong technical understanding of data systems and architecture.
Demonstrated success in engaging with regulators and representing organisational positions.
Hands-on experience with privacy frameworks, including Privacy Impact Assessments.
Exceptional communication skills to translate complex regulatory requirements for diverse audiences.
Strategic thinker with the ability to anticipate regulatory changes and their implications.
Relevant industry qualifications/professional certifications in risk management or compliance.
Ready to Apply?

If you’re a data-driven professional with a passion for regulatory compliance, privacy, and governance, we’d love to hear from you. This is your chance to make a significant impact in a challenging and rewarding leadership role.
This role offers a unique blend of technical, regulatory, and leadership challenges. If you’re ready to take on this exciting opportunity, apply now!
For a confidential chat, contact Jen Jones at Ink Recruitment on +61 (0)409 926 897.

Our client, a retail company, is looking for a Commercial Analyst to join their team on a 9-month basis. There is a possibility of extension or permanency with this role for the right candidate. The office is based in Surry Hills and hybrid working is available.

Daily rate - $500-530 per day + super, dependent on experience


Responsibilities

Analyse promotional activities to optimise return on investment and assess new investment opportunities.
Identify opportunities for gross margin improvement and cost reduction, including product lifecycle and rationalisation analysis.
Prepare financial models and strategic analysis to support long-term planning and decision-making.
Deliver accurate business performance reports and commentary, including month-end tasks and reconciliations.
Lead Onestream implementation and manage monthly data uploads.
Provide data-driven insights to support strategic decisions across sales, marketing, and product development.
Develop pricing models and analyse product range rationalisation aligned with business strategy.
Participate in budgeting, rolling forecasts, and strategic financial planning activities.
Analyse pharmacy performance, promotional effectiveness, rebate systems, and income streams to drive profitability.
Collaborate with finance teams to streamline processes, enhance controls, and reduce manual interventions.

Requirements

Must be available to start immediately
Demonstrated strong commercial acumen and ability to influence stakeholders effectively.
Experience working in large FMCG, retail, or pharmaceutical industries is highly regarded.
Proven ability to work cross-functionally and communicate across all organisational levels.
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel and handling large data sets.
Skilled in using large ERP systems and BI tools.
Ability to deliver analytical insights that add strategic value.
Understanding of the operations and governance of an ASX-listed company.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

If you think you could be suitable for this role, click apply now or send your up-to-date CV to Mollie Wade - mollie.wade@hays.com.au.

Job Title: Senior Investment Analytics and Insights Analyst
Ad Text:
About Cbus
 
Created by workers, for workers, Cbus Super is one of Australia’s most successful Superannuation funds. For almost four decades we’ve proudly represented those who help shape Australia, hard-working individuals who deserve to make the most of their retirement, no matter the industry. As an award-winning fund we’ve been recognised for the benefits provided to our members and our innovative investment approach.  All while staying committed to our member first ethos as a proud Industry Fund.
 
About the role
 
The Senior Investment Analytics and Insights Analyst is pivotal in driving the fund’s digital transformation and enhancing investment decision making. Reporting to the Manager, Investment Insights & Reporting you will support the investment team by delivering data-driven insights and sophisticated analytics through business intelligence tools, enabling a whole-of-fund perspective on performance and risk.
 
The ideal candidate will bring expertise in integrating diverse data sources, building insightful dashboards and working within multi-asset environments. Your deep understanding of investment data and systems will ensure that key metrics are monitored effectively, making this role essential to optimising investment outcomes and strategic fund management.
 
Key Accountabilities

Design and deliver data-driven analytics solutions by collaborating with stakeholders to understand reporting needs
Develop and maintain PowerBI dashboards and data workflows using SQL and data modelling to optimize reporting and insights
Enhance and automate existing reporting processes replacing manual Excel models with scalable data-driven solutions
Support data governance initiatives, including documentation, glossaries and integration with governance tools
Provide training and collaborate across teams to improve data literacy, share knowledge and support long term analytics capabilities
What will you bring?

Experience in a similar Data Analyst or Analytics and Insights Analyst role specifically working with multi asset Investment Data
Strong expertise in SQL, data modeling and building reusable data assets using tools like Excel or Python
Effective communicator and collaborator with experience working across complex stakeholder environments
Proactive and accountable with a focus on automating processes and improving data quality and governance
Knowledge of third-party investment systems such as Factset, Ortec, Pearl, BarraOne, RIMES, Datastream and/or Bloomberg preferred
Exposure to using Microsoft Azure, including managing cloud-based data solutions and supporting platform integration
Belong at Cbus
 
We value difference, and embrace people with diverse backgrounds, experiences, gender identities, abilities and thinking styles. We believe that, with diversity of perspectives and experiences, you get better teams and outcomes. We’re looking for people of all genders, races, nationalities, orientations and of all abilities to join us.
 
We’re keen to hear from you
 
If you've read through the requirements of this role and you feel like you haven’t fully met the criteria, we would still encourage you to apply. We're aware of accessibility barriers when it comes to applying for a job and we want to help. If you require assistance with your application, please contact our Talent Acquisition Team via careers@cbussuper.com.au 
 
Like to know more about working with Cbus? Listen to some of our videos with members of the Cbus team on our website, cbussuper.com.au/careers
 
Applications Close: Tuesday 14 October 2025 
 
This is a full-time position based in Melbourne
 
Agencies, please note: All Cbus vacancies are managed by our internal Talent Acquisition Team.  Should external assistance be required we will reach out to our preferred agency partners, Thank you.

About us

From humble roots in Eromanga, QLD, we’ve been fuelling the furthest corners of Australia for over 40 years. But we think the most exciting journey’s still on the horizon.

Joining IOR puts you in the driver’s seat. You'll get the opportunity to own your ambition and build a worthwhile career - all while seeing your impact on the faces of your team and the communities we serve. You won't see our logo on racing cars, but you will be part of a team that helps fuel LifeFlight's choppers.

Whether you’re driving trucks, designing tech, manufacturing tanks or managing logistics behind the scenes, a career with IOR means going further, in every sense of the word - in your relationships, your impact and your remarkable career.

Right team

Work with people you trust and form relationships that will go the distance
Build something great with a team that will have a laugh and have your back

Right Track

So many career opportunities to explore... and you’re in the driver’s seat
Grow with us at IOR - the bigger we get, the bigger your opportunities become

Right Now

We want you to succeed, so you’re given trust and autonomy to do what it takes
Real momentum, real impact and the sense that there’s plenty more to come

About your role,

We are looking for a highly skilled and motivated Senior Data Scientist to join our growing team at IOR. This role plays a critical part in building a world-class data capability to enhance commercial decision-making, drive margin expansion, and improve operational efficiency. You will work closely with leadership and business teams to design advanced analytics models, unlock insights, and develop tools that power everyday business decisions.

Accelerate enterprise value by embedding performance analytics, pricing intelligence, and data-driven strategy to drive growth and optimise margins.
Embed advanced analytics at scale through machine learning, automation, and scenario modelling to inform operations, strategy, and commercial outcomes.
Elevate pricing performance with custom pricing frameworks driven by market data, operational systems, and IOR’s proprietary Dashboard platform.
Deliver strategic insights by translating complex data into simple, actionable recommendations that influence leadership decisions and operational execution.
Uplift analytical maturity by developing scalable tools, mentoring analysts, and collaborating with tech teams to enhance IOR’s data architecture and capability.

About you

To succeed in this role, you will need the following attributes:

Educational foundation in Data Science, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related discipline (Bachelor’s or Master’s required).
Proven technical expertise in supervised machine learning, statistical modelling, simulations, and advanced programming (Python, R, SQL).
Strong analytical capabilities with experience in large-scale data visualisation, real-time analytics, and cloud infrastructure (preferably Azure).
Experience in advanced analytics, with added value for backgrounds in Monte Carlo simulation, predictive pricing, and supply chain optimisation.
Commercially focused mindset, blending Agile practices with the ability to link analytical outputs to business performance and mentor others.

Why join IOR?

You can feel it from day one. The energy, the growth… the sense that this place is going somewhere. And you're not just along for the ride. You’re behind the wheel.

IOR’s the kind of place where you put your name to a project, and you own it. The wins, the challenges, and everything in between we back you to see it through, even when things don’t go to plan. Support is always there if you need it. Otherwise, you’re trusted to do what it takes to keep things running.

You don’t get that in too many places.

Approaching each day through our values of Innovation finding solutions, Our Communities serving people, and Reliability getting results, our team is focused on delivering what really matters to our customers. It’s this mindset that drives us forward.

The best part? As we grow bigger, the opportunities get bigger, too. Backed by a solid strategy and a right to win, joining our team means more projects, more challenges, and more chances to stretch yourself.

What does this mean for you?

Be part of an unbeatable culture where people really do enjoy coming to work
Investment in your career through training and development programs, ongoing support, plus the backing to take your career in whichever direction you choose
Work hard, play hard with our Blue Squad - trivias, barbecues and plenty of laughs!
Staff and family discounts on fuel (obviously!)

Ready to go further with IOR?

If this sounds like you, don't overthink it - just apply! We're looking forward to meeting you.

We provide an equal employment opportunity for all; we see the value in diversity and celebrate individuality. This looks like respectful conversations and a safe workplace where everyone thrives.

Location: Canberra (Hybrid), other Australian locations considered
Company: Elysium Digital

The Opportunity
Elysium Digital is seeking a strategic and experienced Data Strategist to join our growing team. We partner with government and private sector organisations to unlock the value of their data and enable transformation through trusted, business-aligned data capabilities.
This role sits at the intersection of business and technology, offering the opportunity to lead impactful strategy and architecture engagements. You will work directly with senior stakeholders to simplify complexity, strengthen governance, and lay the foundations for AI and advanced analytics.
If you are passionate about the potential of data to drive meaningful change and eager to lead high-impact initiatives, we invite you to apply.

Key Responsibilities
As a Data Strategist, you will:

Lead the development of data strategies aligned with client business goals, covering governance, architecture, literacy, and AI readiness.
Conduct current and future state assessments, benchmarking against best practices.
Design capability models and pragmatic roadmaps for data uplift.
Engage with senior executives and partners to ensure alignment between business priorities and data initiatives.
Facilitate workshops to co-design visions, principles, and data-driven opportunities.
Provide strategic advisory on data governance, integration, and architecture.
Contribute to the evolution of Elysium’s consulting methodologies.
Support business development through proposals, case studies, and opportunity identification.
About You
You will be a strong candidate if you:

Have extensive experience in data strategy, governance, and architecture.
Are familiar with data management frameworks (e.g. DAMA DMBoK) and enterprise architecture principles.
Can align data and technology strategies with business outcomes.
Have led discovery, strategy, and roadmap engagements.
Possess functional or technical knowledge of platforms such as Fabric, Databricks, Snowflake, Tableau.
Are skilled in stakeholder engagement and executive-level communication.
Can translate complex technical concepts into clear, strategic recommendations.
Are adaptable, creative, and pragmatic in designing actionable solutions.
Hold or are eligible for an AGSVA security clearance.
Why Join Elysium Digital?

Hybrid working model – Flexibility to work from home, client sites, or Elysium offices.
Client impact – Work on meaningful, high-impact projects with government and professional services clients.
Career development – Structured consulting pathway and opportunity to shape a growing data strategy capability.
Work-life balance – A culture that values flexibility and understands personal and professional needs.

Want to bring ideas to life?

You're in the right place. We've been a leading design, engineering and advisory company for decades. So why choose Aurecon? It really comes down to one, crucial question: what kind of world do you want to create for the next generation? Truth is, the decisions being made right now will determine the future of everything - from the local community to the sustainability of our clients' businesses - to the entire planet. One of those decisions is: who do you decide to work for?

How will your ideas contribute to shaping what's next?

Our Adelaide Digital Enablement, Asset Management and Performance team are currently seeking Expressions of Interest from Business Analysts (across junior, mid and senior levels), to work with a group of highly skilled specialists. You'll be a trusted partner to a diverse range of clients in SA and develop a deep understanding of their challenges to co-create innovative solutions that help shape the future.
The work we do is vital to enabling capability, value and operations for our clients. It's the technical expertise and the depth of knowledge of our people that really sets us apart. Here are the key things you will do:

Engage stakeholders to elicit, analyse, and validate business requirements using Agile practices such as user stories, epics, backlog refinement, and participation in Scrum ceremonies.
Collaborate with cross-functional delivery teams - including developers, solution architects, testers, and vendors - to ensure proposed solutions align with business needs and implementation feasibility.
Contribute to end-to-end solution design by defining functional, non-functional, interface, and data requirements to support system development and integration.
Break down complex business needs into smaller, outcome-focused deliverables (e.g. thinly sliced stories) that can be delivered iteratively within sprints.
Manage change requests and prioritisation in partnership with the Product Owner, ensuring traceability and timely approvals throughout the delivery lifecycle.

What are we looking for from you?

Alongside your industry experience in a similar role, you'll also have:

Qualifications in technical discipline such as Information Technology, Software Engineering, Computer Science, or demonstrated experience and relevant certifications in relevant fields (E.G. IIBA certification, Scrum etc).
Proven experience in Agile environments, including participation in ceremonies, user story development, backlog refinement, and use of tools like JIRA and Confluence.
Strong capability in requirements elicitation, business process mapping, and system improvement, using methodologies such as BABOK, Agile, and Waterfall.
Demonstrated ability to collaborate within cross-functional teams (e.g. developers, testers, SMEs, product owners, vendors) and manage competing stakeholder priorities effectively.
Proficiency in documenting and managing business and technical requirements, with a focus on enabling secure and scalable solutions.
Excellent facilitation, interpersonal, and negotiation skills, including experience managing the user impact of change across technologies, operating models, and business processes.

How will your future be shaped by us?

You really can bring your whole self to work and be confident your voice will be heard. We don't just claim we're inclusive and innovative, as proven by the independent awards and accreditations we've gained. We've been recognised for our innovation culture, gender equality and our LGBTI+ inclusion. Plus, we have a robust Reconciliation Action Plan - our fourth edition since 2014.

Ready to bring ideas to life? Apply to join us!


We appreciate the interest of our agency partners, however we're not engaging external recruitment support for this opportunity at this stage.

The Opportunity

Ventia's Group Supply Chain team is excited to offer a new opportunity for a Senior Supply Chain Solutions Lead. In this key leadership role, you will be responsible for shaping and delivering strategic supply chain initiatives that ensure the timely, cost-effective availability of goods and services from our suppliers.

Working in a dynamic and evolving technical environment, you will lead cross-functional projects that enhance operational efficiency, improve supplier performance, and unlock long-term commercial value. Your expertise will be crucial in integrating diverse systems and streamlining processes, enabling smooth transitions, scalable operations, and future-ready supply chain capabilities.

What's in it for you?

Competitive salary package
Flexible work arrangements to support work-life balance
An exciting opportunity to shape the development of innovative solutions across ‘s Group Supply Chain.
Ongoing training and professional development to support your career growth
A range of fantastic Ventia employee benefits, including discounted private health insurance, paid parental leave, discounted travel, and more!

Key Responsibilities

Supply Chain Strategy & Solution Design

Lead the design and implementation of supply chain solutions that prioritize access to information and are aligned with business objectives, supplier capabilities, and system limitations.
Develop and deploy frameworks and models to optimize preferred supplier selection, supporting both category sourcing strategies and project delivery requirements.
Ensure supply chain solutions are aligned with broader business transformation initiatives and the organization's technology roadmap.

Project Leadership & Execution

Manage the full project lifecycle—from scoping and planning through to execution and post-implementation review.
Lead cross-functional project teams, ensuring clearly defined roles, responsibilities, and accountability.
Proactively identify and mitigate risks related to transitioning technical environments and supplier dependencies.

Data-Driven Decision Making

Utilize advanced analytics to evaluate supply chain performance, identify inefficiencies, and anticipate future demand.
Design and implement reporting tools that deliver actionable insights to senior leadership.
Translate complex data into clear, strategic recommendations that enhance business agility and resilience.

Stakeholder Engagement & Change Leadership

Collaborate closely with key internal stakeholders—particularly in supply chain, finance, and project teams—to co-develop effective solutions.
Facilitate workshops and design sessions to align on priorities, define solution pathways, and build consensus.
Lead change management initiatives to drive the successful adoption of new systems, processes, and ways of working.

Could You Be Our Senior Supply Chain Solutions Lead?

Hold extensive experience in supply chain strategy, project execution, or supplier enablement.
Demonstrated success in navigating complex and evolving technical environments.
Strong proficiency in ERP systems such as SAP or Oracle (critical), with experience in data analytics tools like Power BI or Tableau, and working knowledge of SQL (preferred).
Professional certification in Project Management (e.g., PMP, PRINCE2) or Lean Six Sigma is advantageous.
Background in solution architecture or large-scale supply chain transformation initiatives.
Excellent communication, negotiation, and stakeholder management capabilities.
Proven ability to lead through ambiguity and deliver results in fast-paced, dynamic settings.
Bachelor's degree in Supply Chain, Business, Engineering, or a related field is beneficial.

About Ventia

Ventia is a leading infrastructure services company, operating across Australia and New Zealand. Our clients are the owners and operators of assets that are critical to our local communities. We pride ourselves on working smart, safely and sustainably, harnessing the latest technologies and brightest minds. With a diverse and proud heritage, we have a track record of delivering essential services to the communities in which we operate.

Diversity

Ventia is enriched by the diverse experiences, talents and cultures that our people bring to the organisation, while celebrating and respecting the communities we operate in. We are committed to providing a safe and positive environment that provides equal opportunities for individuals of all backgrounds, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, LGBTQIA+, Women, Veterans and spouses and people with disabilities.

How to apply

If you are looking to expand your career with a business that rewards and values its employees, please apply below by clicking on the apply now button.

Position Reference Number: 164637

Bengalla Mining Company (a member of New Hope Group) is a joint venture with a strong track record of achievement. Our focus is on maintaining strong safety, productivity, and profitability results. We have a very collaborative team culture and a highly professional and rewarding work environment. Operational since 1999, Bengalla is in Muswellbrook in the Hunter Valley, and supplies international markets with approximately 13 Mtpa.

Bengalla is an open pit coal mine offering a residential lifestyle. The development consent for the operation provides the ability to mine through to 2039. We pride ourselves on the professionalism with which we pursue our goals and our strong links into our community.

The Role

We are currently seeking an experienced Senior Financial Analyst to join the Bengalla Commercial team on a Permanent, Fulltime basis.

Reporting to the Commercial Manager, you will be responsible for:

The annual business plan and regular reforecasting processes
Capital management and providing guidance to internal stakeholders
Leadership of the site Business Improvement function including investment analysis
Business risk management based on value enhancement
Insurance management and co-ordination of renewals
Liaising with senior management team and wider business

In this role, you will also provide Bengalla Mine management with analysis of strategic business options and reasoned recommendations for business enhancement.

Qualifications and experience

To be successful, you will need:

Commercial or Accounting qualifications (CPA or CA well regarded)
Mining industry experience
Excellent stakeholder engagement and communication skills
Ability to work in a small friendly team
Focus on continuous improvement and value creation
Experience with Pulse ERP and Xeras modelling software is desirable but not essential


What We Offer  
Bengalla values its people and their contribution to the operation. Our well-established employee benefits program offers choice and flexibility to enhance the lifestyle and wellbeing of our team. With benefits including subsidised health insurance, salary packaging, self-education assistance and gym memberships we make the health, safety, and well-being of our people our absolute priority.
  
This is a great opportunity to join the professional and friendly team at Bengalla Mining Company and opportunities such as this are few within the region.

To apply online, please click on the appropriate link below.

About the Role

As the Senior Manager, you will lead the development and execution of the organisation’s data and analytics roadmap, ensuring alignment with strategic priorities. You will mentor and develop a team of Analysts, fostering a culture of technical excellence and continuous learning, while championing data-driven decision-making across the business. A key part of the role is to translate complex data findings into clear insights for non-technical stakeholders and collaborate closely with Data Scientists, Engineers, and Technology teams to deliver innovative solutions.

You will also be responsible for building scalable data pipelines and cloud-based analytics solutions, ensuring accuracy, integrity, and compliance with regulatory standards. The role requires expertise in data modelling, ETL, governance, and cloud platforms, alongside proven leadership in managing technical teams and complex projects. By engaging with the Executive Team, Heads of Departments, and external vendors, you’ll provide strategic insights on emerging data technologies while ensuring best practices and compliance within the financial services environment.

As the Senior Manager within the Data Engineer team, you will report to the Head of Analytics Innovation.

Your responsibilities will be; but are not limited to;

Lead the development and execution of the analytics roadmap aligned with strategic priorities.
Mentor and develop a team of Data Analysts, fostering a culture of continuous learning and technical excellence.
Champion data-driven decision-making across the organisation.
Translate complex data findings into compelling stories for non-technical stakeholders.
Collaborate with Data Scientists, Engineers, and Technology teams to deliver innovative solutions.
Drive data governance, quality, and compliance with regulatory standards.
Provide strategic insights into emerging data technologies and methodologies.
Key Responsibilities

Build scalable data pipelines and cloud-based analytics solutions.
Ensure data accuracy, integrity, and consistency.
Develop and enforce best practices for data analysis.
Maintain compliance with financial services data handling and privacy standards.
Engage with internal stakeholders including the Executive Team, Heads of Departments, and external vendors.
About You
You'll bring:

A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Engineering, or related field.
7+ years' experience in data engineering, data management, or analytics.
Proven leadership in managing technical teams and complex projects.
Expertise in data modeling, ETL, warehousing, and governance.
Proficiency in cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) and CI/CD tools (Azure DevOps, GitHub Actions).
Strong communication skills and the ability to influence across all levels of the organisation.
About Us

Teachers Mutual Bank Limited is one of the largest mutual banks in Australia. We are a globally-recognised socially responsible bank with profit-for-purpose as our businessmodel and philosophy. At our Bank, social responsibility is built-in, not bolted on and drives our business practices, people, and products.
  
We are proud to serve some of Australia's essential workers in education, emergency services and healthcare. We believe they deserve a bank that does good for their community.
  
We have been named one of the World's Most Ethical Companies for ten years in a row and are a Certified B Corp Bank.

Our employees embrace our organisation's values of passion, advocacy and sustainability, and contribute to a diverse and inclusive workplace culture founded on mutual respect, equality and a focus on striving to deliver exceptional member service.
  
We work under a hybrid working model to provide flexibility in the workplace. For more information about working conditions as well as our employee value proposition, please visit the careers page on our website at www.tmbank.com.au or find us on LinkedIn!

How to apply 

Please click the APPLY button and follow the prompts.
  
For a confidential conversation, please contact lflett@tmbl.com.au     
  
Teachers Mutual Bank Ltd may conduct a background or reference check (or both) as part of the recruitment process. By applying you agree to cooperate fully in those procedures and understand that an offer is subject to the satisfactory outcome of those checks, at the discretion of Teachers Mutual Bank Ltd.
